Vaughan is the writer and co-creator of comic-book series including SAGA, PAPER GIRLS, Y THE LAST MAN, RUNAWAYS, and most recently, BARRIER, a digital comic with artist Marcos Martin about immigration, available from their pay-what-you-want site <a href="http://www.PanelSyndicate.com" rel="noopener nofollow" target="_blank">www.PanelSyndicate.com</a><br/><br/>BKV's work has been recognized at the Eisner, Harvey, Hugo, Shuster, Eagle, and British Fantasy Awards. He sometimes writes for film and television in Los Angeles, where he lives with his family and their dogs Hamburger and Milkshake. </span></div></div></div><div class=""></div></div><hr class="Divider 9.63469Z"></path></svg></span></span></div><span class="Text Text__body3"><a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/2137944082">November 7, 2018</a></span></section><section class="ReviewText"><section class="ReviewText__content" dir="auto"><div class="TruncatedContent" tabindex="-1"><div class="TruncatedContent__text TruncatedContent__text--large" data-testid="contentContainer" tabindex="-1"><span class="Formatted"><b>oooh, goodreads choice awards semifinalist for best graphic novel 2018! what will happen?</b><br/><br/><i>When did you first know that you’d give up your life for someone? Okay, maybe you’ve never felt that way, but parents usually say that about their offspring, right? Personally, I think it’s almost always a dumb idea to sacrifice your own existence for others. Or worse, for some “cause.” If we were all a little more selfish instead of being in such a hurry to defend everything to the death, the universe would be a much less scary place.</i><br/><br/><img class="gr-hostedUserImg" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1517091141i/24948744._SY540_.jpg"/><br/><br/>there is so much in this one, it makes my head spin. and for the first time, i’m deeply glad i didn’t read these as individual comic book issues. #43-#46 are excellent and i would only have been frustrated by how short they were and how cliffhanger-y their ends, but #47 and #48 would have felt like total letdowns on their own, just because of who’s there, who’s <i>not</i> there, and as a contrast to how very strong the first four segments of this collection were. and yes, i gave the entire volume five stars despite the last two being less shiny, but i’m terrible at math and -oh no! are those <i>dung people</i>?<br/><br/><img class="gr-hostedUserImg" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1517091141i/24948747._SX540_.jpg"/><br/><br/>basically, the inclusion of dung people rounds any book up to an automatic five stars. <br/><br/>but there are plenty of other things here helping earn that five stars.<br/><br/>this, obviously<br/><br/><img class="gr-hostedUserImg" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1517091141i/24948750._SX540_.jpg"/><br/><br/>also, there are so many wonderful moments of underplayed reactions throughout this series, but there are some particularly funny ones this time out <br/><br/><img class="gr-hostedUserImg" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1517091141i/24948749._SY540_.jpg"/><br/><br/>and hazel’s fumbling attempts at cussin’ are endearing enough<br/><br/><img class="gr-hostedUserImg" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1517091141i/24948751._SX540_.jpg"/><br/><br/>but not as endearing as the contrast between what her parents identify as the teaching moment<br/><br/><img class="gr-hostedUserImg" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1517091141i/24948752._SX540_.jpg"/><br/> <br/>also<br/><br/><img class="gr-hostedUserImg" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1517091141i/24948743._SY540_.jpg"/><br/><br/>all of the abortion town/badlands parts were handled so well - providing a variety of cultural perspectives on the abortion issue that are consistent with other things we know about the values of these different realms, plus some insight into the individuals involved, and a perfect balance of heartbreaking stuff and … less heartbreaking stuff<br/><br/><img class="gr-hostedUserImg" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1517091141i/24948748._SX540_.jpg"/><br/><br/>obviously, hazel is great here, she always is, but she’s also wrestling with some pretty big questions that no one <i>really</i> has the answers for.<br/><br/><img class="gr-hostedUserImg" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1517091141i/24948745._SX540_.jpg"/><br/><br/>petrichor is outstanding in this one; she gets to be maternal and brave and fierce and vulnerable and horny and so many other things, including deeply relieved<br/><br/><img class="gr-hostedUserImg" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1517091141i/24948746._SX540_.jpg"/><br/><br/>and she does give good advice<br/><br/><i>…you are unlike anyone who has ever existed, and that makes you <b>exactly</b> like everyone who has ever existed.</i><br/><br/>she's closer than anyone else to being able to understand hazel's state of mind, and if we had to lose that other hazel-helper, i'm glad petrichor is there to pick up the slack.<br/><br/>and let the record show i am furious at this bitch’s...interior design choices and if she goes ANYWHERE near lying cat, i will draw myself into a little cartoon and breach the panel’s boundaries to cut her into little pieces. <br/><br/><img class="gr-hostedUserImg" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1517091141i/24948753._SY540_.jpg"/><br/><br/>just try me.<br/><br/>*******************************************<br/><br/>OH GOD SO GOOD!<br/><br/>real review coming but if this series ever ends, i might lose my mind. never stop, please.<br/><br/><img class="gr-hostedUserImg" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1528725630i/25720315.png"/><a href="http://bloggycomelately.com/" rel="nofollow noopener">come to my blog!</a></span></div><div class=""></div></div></section></section><section class="ReviewCard__tags"><ul class="CollapsableList"><span tabindex="-1"><a class="Button Button--tag-inline Button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/list/45618?shelf=youre-a-graphic-novel"><span class="Button__labelItem">youre-a-graphic-novel</span></a></span><span tabindex="-1"></span></ul></section><footer class="SocialFooter"><div class="SocialFooter__statsContainer" data-testid="stats"><div class="Button__container"><button class="Button Button--inline Button--small Button--subdued" type="button"><span class="Button__labelItem">228 class="ReviewText"><section class="ReviewText__content" dir="auto"><div class="TruncatedContent" tabindex="-1"><div class="TruncatedContent__text TruncatedContent__text--large" data-testid="contentContainer" tabindex="-1"><span class="Formatted"><b>Warning: Spoilers for the previous volume!</b><br/><i>But I'm going to try my hardest not to spoil anything from this one, ok?</i><br/><br/><img alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg" height="250" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1515602015i/24865215._SX540_.jpg" width="400"/><br/><br/>Ok, if you read the last volume, you know that Alana's baby didn't make it. <br/>So, once the shock wears off, what exactly happens next? <br/>Now, I know this is touchy territory for a lot of people, but Vaughn went there anyway.<br/>Late-term abortion. If nothing else, you probably heard the sound bites about during the last US election. <i>Good times, good times...</i><br/>Personally, I am 100% for late-term abortions.<br/>And for those of you out there that actually believe that means doctors pull 9 month old healthy babies from wombs and put them into a wood chipper, then I doubt anything I or anyone else could say will make a difference.<br/>But.<br/>For the rest of you?<br/>Here's why someone who has had <b>4 unwanted pregnancies</b>, but didn't get abortions for any of them (<i>*waves to kids*</i>), would support another woman's right to choose to end her pregnancy late in the game. <br/>Because I couldn't imagine how horrible and hard it would be to keep carrying my dying baby inside of me for months. <i>Months!</i> And you know your child won't survive. But you can't help them, and you know that your child's suffering hasn't even begun yet. Won't begin, until you give birth to them. <br/>Life is cruel like that sometimes. <br/>Children die. And parents grieve...for the rest of their lives.<br/>I personally believe that if you are ever in that situation and want to carry the baby to term, then that's your <i>choice</i>. But I also believe that a woman should have the <i>option</i> to begin the grieving and healing sooner.<br/><br/>At any rate, I thought Vaughn dealt with this subject in a respectful way.<br/><br/> <img alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg" height="190" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1515602015i/24865216._SX540_.jpg" width="400"/><br/><br/>The stuff with The Will was short but still made an impact on the story. You get a peek at his <i>origin story</i>, while also adding another potentially explosive new personality into the mix!<br/><br/><img alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg" height="160" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1515602170i/24865220._SX540_.jpg" width="400"/><br/><br/>I love Petrichor. Even if she is a <i>tad</i> grumpy.<br/>But she gets to shine like a badass during <b>Vol. 8</b>, and there are some interesting developments that...well, <b>spoilers</b>. Sorry.<br/><br/><img alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg" height="170" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1515602625i/24865235._SX540_.jpg" width="400"/><br/><br/>Due to the nature of Alan's pregnancy, there's a rather huge, and spoilery, shock in store for everyone. Again...sorry.<br/><br/> <img alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg" height="170" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1515602015i/24865214._SX540_.jpg" width="400"/><br/> <br/>Oh, and you know how I wasn't quite as moved at the end of the last volume, while all the rest of you were crying so hard you had snot bubbles coming out of your nose?<br/><b>Well. The panel below got me.</b><br/>I read that scene and I made this choking noise out loud. <br/><b>huup-huup-errk-gaak-uuuuh</b><br/><br/> <img alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg" height="160" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1515602093i/24865218._SX540_.jpg" width="400"/><br/><br/>Goddammit, Saga! You're ruining my tough-girl image!<br/><br/><b>Another excellent volume and (as always) highly recommended.</b></span></div><div class=""></div></div></section></section><section class="ReviewCard__tags"><ul class="CollapsableList"><span tabindex="-1"><a class="Button Button--tag-inline Button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/list/1720620?shelf=graphic-novels"><span class="Button__labelItem">graphic-novels</span></a><span tabindex="-1"> </span><a class="Button Button--tag-inline Button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/list/1720620?shelf=hoopla"><span class="Button__labelItem">hoopla</span></a><span tabindex="-1"> </span><a class="Button Button--tag-inline Button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/list/1720620?shelf=read-in-2018"><span class="Button__labelItem">read-in-2018</span></a></span><span tabindex="-1"></span> <div class="Button__container"><button aria-label="Show all items in the list" class="Button Button--tag-inline Button--small" type="button"><span class="Button__labelItem">...more</span></button></div></ul></section><footer class="SocialFooter"><div class="SocialFooter__statsContainer" data-testid="stats"><div class="Button__container"><button class="Button Button--inline Button--small Button--subdued" type="button"><span class="Button__labelItem">3 likes</span></button></div></div><div data-testid="actions"><div class="SocialFooter__action"><div class="Button__container"><button aria-label="Review unliked. 2019</a></span></section><section class="ReviewText"><section class="ReviewText__content" dir="auto"><div class="TruncatedContent" tabindex="-1"><div class="TruncatedContent__text TruncatedContent__text--large" data-testid="contentContainer" tabindex="-1"><span class="Formatted">Hell yes! God I LOVE LOVE LOVE Saga! The artwork, the storyline, the characters and monsters, the absurdity and yet the wonderful social commentary under the surface all works marvelously. In Vol 8, things are just as interesting and quirky and sexy and violent as in the seven preceding volumes but this one is particularly satisfying in how It brings everyone together near the end. I hope this series never ends because it is truly one of the greatest comic series going today. I have read loads of other ones in the sci-fi, superhero, and fantasy realms, but Saga just takes everything a notch higher and faster and never panders or condescends. Between the consistency in the storyline, the creativity of the characters, the engaging personalities...there is just so much depth and wonder here that you have to read it yourself to appreciate it. Still the best.</span></div><div class=""></div></div></section></section><section class="ReviewCard__tags"><ul class="CollapsableList"><span tabindex="-1"><a class="Button Button--tag-inline Button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/list/48483884?shelf=american-21st-c"><span class="Button__labelItem">american-21st-c</span></a><span tabindex="-1"> </span><a class="Button Button--tag-inline Button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/list/48483884?shelf=fiction"><span class="Button__labelItem">fiction</span></a><span tabindex="-1"> </span><a class="Button Button--tag-inline Button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/list/48483884?shelf=graphic-novels"><span class="Button__labelItem">graphic-novels</span></a></span><span tabindex="-1"></span> <div class="Button__container"><button aria-label="Show all items in the list" class="Button Button--tag-inline Button--small" type="button"><span class="Button__labelItem">...more</span></button></div></ul></section><footer class="SocialFooter"><div class="SocialFooter__statsContainer" data-testid="stats"><div class="Button__container"><button class="Button Button--inline Button--small Button--subdued" type="button"><span class="Button__labelItem">2 likes</span></button></div></div><div data-testid="actions"><div class="SocialFooter__action"><div class="Button__container"><button aria-label="Review unliked. 2018</a></span></section><section class="ReviewText"><section class="ReviewText__content" dir="auto"><div class="TruncatedContent" tabindex="-1"><div class="TruncatedContent__text TruncatedContent__text--large" data-testid="contentContainer" tabindex="-1"><span class="Formatted">Re-Read 5/16/18:<br><br>There's nothing much else I can say I didn't already say. :) I'm hooked forever.<br><br><br>Original Review:<br><br>There's no way in hell I can call this series anything other than MY FAVORITE COMIC EVER.<br><br>It truly has everything. Love, heartbreak, cute, strange, brilliance, funny, mind-blowing, edifying, and JUST PLAIN AWESOME.<br><br>Did I mention that it's rather cool?<br><br>After the heartache of the last volume, I've been anxious and anxious to avoid this one because of the things it might do to me.<br><br>It did all those things I was worried about, but it had that right level of oddball humor to make it all OKAY. <br><br>I'm thinking mostly about the sight of a blood-drenched werewolf abortionist. You know. Details.</br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></span></div><div class=""></div></div></section></section><section class="ReviewCard__tags"><ul class="CollapsableList"><span tabindex="-1"><a class="Button Button--tag-inline Button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/list/4213258?shelf=2018-shelf"><span class="Button__labelItem">2018-shelf</span></a><span tabindex="-1"> </span><a class="Button Button--tag-inline Button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/list/4213258?shelf=fanboy-goes-squee"><span class="Button__labelItem">fanboy-goes-squee</span></a><span tabindex="-1"> </span><a class="Button Button--tag-inline Button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/list/4213258?shelf=fantasy"><span class="Button__labelItem">fantasy</span></a></span><span tabindex="-1"></span> <div class="Button__container"><button aria-label="Show all items in the list" class="Button Button--tag-inline Button--small" type="button"><span class="Button__labelItem">...more</span></button></div></ul></section><footer class="SocialFooter"><div class="SocialFooter__statsContainer" data-testid="stats"><div class="Button__container"><button class="Button Button--inline Button--small Button--subdued" type="button"><span class="Button__labelItem">1 like</span></button></div></div><div data-testid="actions"><div class="SocialFooter__action"><div class="Button__container"><button aria-label="Review unliked. class="RatingStar__backgroundFill" clip-path="url(#clip_RatingStar_undefined0small)" href="#path_RatingStar_undefined0small"></use><path class="RatingStar__fill"></path></svg></span></span></div><span class="Text Text__body3"><a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/5388444260">August 1, 2018</a></span></section><section class="ReviewText"><section class="ReviewText__content" dir="auto"><div class="TruncatedContent" tabindex="-1"><div class="TruncatedContent__text TruncatedContent__text--large" data-testid="contentContainer" tabindex="-1"><span class="Formatted"><a href="https://bookspoils.wordpress.com" rel="nofollow noopener">
<img alt="Saga, vol 8 7-- bookspoils" class="gr-hostedUserImg" height="490" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1516111554i/24885529._SX540_.png" width="500"/>
</a><br/><br/>After the traumatic events of the War for Phang, Hazel, her parents, and their surviving companions embark on a life-changing adventure at the westernmost edge of the universe.<br/><br/>Trying to gather together my scattered thoughts regarding this newest volume in the <strong>Saga</strong> series is turning out to be rather hard, so I opted for making this bullet point list below:<br/><br/>(Spoilers from here.)<br/><br/>• The start of the journey took us to Abortion Town, after the unfortunate events of the last volume, where solid commentary was present in the precarious situation.<br/><br/><a href="https://bookspoils.wordpress.com" rel="nofollow noopener">
<img alt="Saga, vol 8 1-- bookspoils" class="gr-hostedUserImg" height="248" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1516111554i/24885530._SX540_.png" width="601"/>
</a><br/><br/>• This lullaby tribute to our most iconic babysitter, Izabel:<br/><br/><a href="https://bookspoils.wordpress.com" rel="nofollow noopener">
<img alt="Saga, vol 8 2-- bookspoils" class="gr-hostedUserImg" height="767" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1516111554i/24885531._SY540_.png" width="485"/>
</a><br/><br/>• The emotional bond between Hazel and "make-believe" Kurti. This is what this volume was truly about: focusing on fleshing out character-based storylines, which is incidentally how I like my stories best. <br/><br/><a href="https://bookspoils.wordpress.com" rel="nofollow noopener">
<img alt="Saga, vol 8 5-- bookspoils" class="gr-hostedUserImg" height="395" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1516111554i/24885532._SX540_.png" width="554"/>
</a><br/>This moment of impact... She's maturing at a rapid pace.<br/><br/><a href="https://bookspoils.wordpress.com" rel="nofollow noopener">
<img alt="Saga, vol 8 3-- bookspoils" class="gr-hostedUserImg" height="396" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1516111554i/24885533._SX540_.png" width="556"/>
</a><br/>This girl has known too much loss in her young life.<br/><br/>• Which then leads me back to Alana having to suffer through her miscarriage; it was utterly hard-hitting. Ultimately, she's one the most formidable and fearsome protagonists I've encountered in my reading of graphic novels.<br/><br/><a href="https://bookspoils.wordpress.com" rel="nofollow noopener">
<img alt="Saga, vol 8 6-- bookspoils" class="gr-hostedUserImg" height="630" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1516111554i/24885534._SY540_.png" width="400"/>
</a><br/>Hazel's narration throughout was particularly grounding.<br/><br/>• And last but not least, I have to mention that the completion of this volume was spectacular. I love how everything came together and connected seamlessly. Plus, the gorgeous artwork by Fiona Staples that brings the world and characters within to life.<br/><br/><a href="https://bookspoils.wordpress.com" rel="nofollow noopener">
<img alt="Saga, vol 8 7-- bookspoils" class="gr-hostedUserImg" height="610" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1516111554i/24885535._SY540_.jpg" width="400"/>
</a><br/><br/><img alt="bookspoils" class="gr-hostedUserImg" height="31" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1519483221i/25115431.png" width="35"/><img alt="bookspoils" class="gr-hostedUserImg" height="31" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1519483221i/25115431.png" width="35"/><img alt="bookspoils" class="gr-hostedUserImg" height="31" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1519483221i/25115431.png" width="35"/><img alt="bookspoils" class="gr-hostedUserImg" height="31" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1519483221i/25115431.png" width="35"/><br/><br/><i>

2022</a></span></section><section class="ReviewText"><section class="ReviewText__content" dir="auto"><div class="TruncatedContent" tabindex="-1"><div class="TruncatedContent__text TruncatedContent__text--large" data-testid="contentContainer" tabindex="-1"><span class="Formatted">“One day, a boy decided to break the rules. And that boy would become my brother”--Hazel <br><br>(You don't know what this means, and the implications of this, until the very last page).<br><br>So I am in the process of rereading all the volumes, more than four years later, and in case you are wondering, the feels are more profound when you have a fuller realization of everything that is happening, so I encourage you to reread these, at least before volume ten arrives, supposedly in August 2022?<br><br>Original review, 12/17/2017, with some small edits and revisions throughout: <br><br>Saga is clearly one of the greatest comics series of all time, sustaining an impressive critical and popular reception over years. And it is remarkable in part because, while it just looks like a space opera, on the surface, it pushes various envelopes in the process. Volume 7 was powerful, an event of the year in comics, with a sad loss I won’t be specific about, exactly. And now volume 8 deals with the aftermath of the volume 7’s loss, and that makes this once again one of the most powerful volumes of the series, in what were for me with surprising and original turns.<br><br>So along the way, Vaughn and Staples are at turns profane, hilarious, and heartbreaking, as they deal with hot-button political issues, including miscarriage, and abortion, all of which are of course sensitive personal and political issues today, issues that deeply divide and pain many of us. How can they speak to these issues in a fresh and useful way? Well, they do, heart-rendingly, with originality and a sense of closure. <br><br>We get a certain portion of (humorous) shock and the profane: <br><br>*The volume opens with Alana and Sir Robot at the entrance of Abortion Town, which I might make some readers who do not trust Vaughn just close the book. Can any other book anywhere have that shocking opening?! And then turn you right around and make you care, regardless of where you are on the political continuum on this topic?! <br><br>*In that "profane" category, we are introduced to the idea of “dung people”(animated feces?). (Just because they can, and I'll say, it's an act of misdirection to set you up for some of the truly moving things that happen later. <br><br>*A funny scene with cunnilingus (Apple had censored a gay oral sex scene in 2013, so I am sure they thought: Why not see if we again yank the chain again? Similarly, as some people didn't like public breastfeeding a few years ago, Staples puts a close-up of a huge breast nursing Hazel on the cover. Funny? So maybe these images can offend some, but at this point, they can have their fun and know most readers will not cry out in protest. <br><br>*De-nose-ification?<br><br>*Petrichor praying earnestly for. . . sex? Petrichor goes up in everyone's estimation in this volume, for sure. And then there are moments with Sir Robot. You don't like trans folks? You don't like rich royals? Staples and Vaughn put them together and make you care about them. Yep, we find people to like across the political spectrum, all kinds. <br><br>There are some other really cool ideas in this one:<br><br>* “Forecasting” as a special ability, that allows us to experience Hazel’s “brother.” This would seem to be a power like prescience, but in this case it creates a simultaneously anguished and moving set of events I just can't spoil for you.<br><br>*We are introduced to the concept of an endwife (instead of a midwife), which maybe is a little like a hospice nurse, I guess, but I liked how they use it here. <br><br>*Oh, and you were wondering, above: Does Petrichor get an answer to her prayer? Gotta read it, but again, what happens is not obvious to anyone unless you expect the unexpected.<br><br>*There’s cameos of some characters you have missed lately: Lying Cat! And Ghus, of course!<br><br>*You may know that Saga is a kind of tribute to Star Wars, and you may also know that the westerns George Lucas grew up reading and watching created part of the foundation for his epec series. So it is kind of cool that this volume is conceived as a western, with drawling locals. <br><br>I was in this reading much more moved than the first read. Our favorite family Markus, Alana, and Hazel is central, and so connected, we care about them so much. And the scenes with Kurti and Hazel, maybe especially the last scene: Uh. I may not have any actual experience with forecasting--though I have certainly imagined futures of people who no longer live; I have day- and night-dreams of meeting and talking with them--but I do have some painful experiences with child/fetus loss, and in many ways with many family and friends. This thread/sequence was a very moving sequence, let me just say that. It has great surprises in it, and the ending is terrific. Read it!</br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></span></div><div class=""></div></div></section></section><section class="ReviewCard__tags"><ul class="CollapsableList"><span tabindex="-1"><a class="Button Button--tag-inline Button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/list/269235?shelf=gn-superhero-scifi-fantasy"><span class="Button__labelItem">gn-superhero-scifi-fantasy</span></a><span tabindex="-1"> </span><a class="Button Button--tag-inline Button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/list/269235?shelf=vaughn"><span class="Button__labelItem">vaughn</span></a></span><span tabindex="-1"></span></ul></section><footer class="SocialFooter"><div class="SocialFooter__statsContainer" data-testid="stats"><div class="Button__container"><button class="Button Button--inline Button--small Button--subdued" type="button"><span class="Button__labelItem">1 like</span></button></div></div><div data-testid="actions"><div class="SocialFooter__action"><div class="Button__container"><button aria-label="Review unliked. Press to like review" class="Button Button--inline Button--small" type="button"><span class="Button__labelItem"><i class="Icon LikeIcon"><svg viewbox="0 0 24 24"><path d="M14.4813282,6.41129383 L14.586127,6.97676447 C14.5964421,7.03541935 14.6071117,7.09675198 14.6181364,7.1607667 L14.8551301,8.60363442 L17.440983,8.60363442 C18.1623576,8.60363442 18.8218187,9.01120377 19.1444272,9.65642083 L19.1708204,9.70920723 C19.4523479,10.2722622 19.4523479,10.9350066 19.1708204,11.4980616 L19.118034,11.6036344 L19.1708204,11.7092072 C19.4523479,12.2722622 19.4523479,12.9350066 19.1708204,13.4980616 L19.118034,13.6036344 L19.1708204,13.7092072 C19.4523479,14.2722622 19.4523479,14.9350066 19.1708204,15.4980616 L19,15.8397024 L19,16.1036344 C19,16.7361314 18.6701344,17.3185188 class="Text Text__body3"><a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/5388444320">February 12, 2018</a></span></section><section class="ReviewText"><section class="ReviewText__content" dir="auto"><div class="TruncatedContent" tabindex="-1"><div class="TruncatedContent__text TruncatedContent__text--large" data-testid="contentContainer" tabindex="-1"><span class="Formatted">If you’re interested in reading Saga, you’re about as likely to jump in at Vol. 8 as I am to wax my bikini line (now THERE’S a visual no one anywhere ever in the history of the world ever anywhere ever never ever needed), so, really, you’d be primarily interested in my take on this most recent volume if you’ve read Saga previously. So, I’ll say this: Vol. 8 is Saga at its Saga-est, which means it’s by turns irreverent, disgusting, offensive, pulse-pounding, heartwarming, weird, addictive, and occasionally annoying. <br><br>If you made it through the prior seven volumes, you’ll want to keep going. If you stopped somewhere after two or three, stick with it—the series has its flaws, but it’s one of the more interesting and engaging things bopping around on the (sort of) mainstream comic circuit these days. <br><br>Also, on the plus side, no massive and veiny robot schlongs this time around.</br></br></br></br></span></div><div class=""></div></div></section></section><section class="ReviewCard__tags"><ul class="CollapsableList"><span tabindex="-1"></span><span tabindex="-1"></span></ul></section><footer class="SocialFooter"><div class="SocialFooter__statsContainer" data-testid="stats"><div class="Button__container"><button class="Button Button--inline Button--small Button--subdued" type="button"><span class="Button__labelItem">1 like</span></button></div></div><div data-testid="actions"><div class="SocialFooter__action"><div class="Button__container"><button aria-label="Review unliked. Press to like review" class="Button Button--inline Button--small" type="button"><span class="Button__labelItem"><i class="Icon LikeIcon"><svg viewbox="0 0 24 24"><path d="M14.4813282,6.41129383 L19.1708204,9.70920723 C19.4523479,10.2722622 19.4523479,10.9350066 19.1708204,11.4980616 L19.118034,11.6036344 L19.1708204,11.7092072 C19.4523479,12.2722622 19.4523479,12.9350066 class="ReviewText"><section class="ReviewText__content" dir="auto"><div class="TruncatedContent" tabindex="-1"><div class="TruncatedContent__text TruncatedContent__text--large" data-testid="contentContainer" tabindex="-1"><span class="Formatted">Saga continues to impress and shock. This series is definitely not for everyone and I feel like this issue went farther when it comes to controversial issues and content than any previous issue. It makes it one heck of a ride, but proceed with caution if you offend easily!<br/><br/><img class="gr-hostedUserImg" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1540177863i/26482039._SX540_.jpg"/><br/><br/>For me, the controversial content (which I cannot specify without spoilers) is presented in a fascinating and moving way. It is not always easy to weave sensitive content into a story, but this volume handles two or three hot button topics pretty perfectly. <br/><br/><img class="gr-hostedUserImg" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1540177863i/26482040._SX540_.jpg"/><br/><br/>The art continues to be fantastic: detailed, beautiful, at times grotesque, always wonderful to look at. I am so glad that this series has kept up a high standard of illustration through eight volumes.<br/><br/><img class="gr-hostedUserImg" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1540177863i/26482038._SX540_.jpg"/><br/><br/>Graphic novel fans, sci-fi fans, fans of stories that do not hesitate to shock in order to make a statement - you must all read this series!</span></div><div class=""></div></div></section></section><section class="ReviewCard__tags"><ul class="CollapsableList"><span tabindex="-1"><a class="Button Button--tag-inline Button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/list/16254355?shelf=2018"><span class="Button__labelItem">2018</span></a><span tabindex="-1"> </span><a class="Button Button--tag-inline Button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/list/16254355?shelf=gr_awards_2018"><span class="Button__labelItem">gr_awards_2018</span></a><span tabindex="-1"> </span><a class="Button Button--tag-inline Button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/list/16254355?shelf=graphic-novel"><span class="Button__labelItem">graphic-novel</span></a></span><span tabindex="-1"></span> <div class="Button__container"><button aria-label="Show all items in the list" class="Button Button--tag-inline Button--small" type="button"><span class="Button__labelItem">...more</span></button></div></ul></section><footer class="SocialFooter"><div class="SocialFooter__statsContainer" data-testid="stats"><div class="Button__container"><button class="Button Button--inline Button--small Button--subdued" type="button"><span class="Button__labelItem">3 likes</span></button></div></div><div data-testid="actions"><div class="SocialFooter__action"><div class="Button__container"><button aria-label="Review unliked. class="RatingStar__backgroundFill" clip-path="url(#clip_RatingStar_undefined0small)" href="#path_RatingStar_undefined0small"></use><path class="RatingStar__fill"></path></svg></span></span></div><span class="Text Text__body3"><a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/2382574832">December 25, 2021</a></span></section><section class="ReviewText"><section class="ReviewText__content" dir="auto"><div class="TruncatedContent" tabindex="-1"><div class="TruncatedContent__text TruncatedContent__text--large" data-testid="contentContainer" tabindex="-1"><span class="Formatted">2021 reread:<br/><br/>This is nicely setting up volume 9, I guess. Although some people may wish it all ended here. But when everything seems to be going swimmingly life usually throws you a curve ball. It's just what life does.<br/><br/>For me sometimes the plot moved too swiftly here. Occasionally it felt like some things were brushed over or obstacles were moved out of the way too conveniently. So, yeah, probably not my favorite volume. But that one panel with Hazel and Kurti on the sofa... I got a little emotional there. Overall this was still pretty great. On to volume 9.<br/><br/><i>Buddy read with <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/user/show/3672777-nataliya" rel="nofollow noopener">Nataliya</a>, who's one of those people that wished it would have ended here, I suppose.</i><br/><br/><br/>2018 review:<br/><br/>My vote for this year's Goodreads Choice Award for Best Graphic Novel.<br/><i>(Well, after my write-in vote didn't make it.)</i><br/><br/><b>4.5 stars</b> and the slight edge over Vaughan's <a href="https://goodreads.com/book/show/35989512.Paper_Girls__Vol__4" rel="noopener" title="Paper Girls, Vol. 4 by Brian K. Vaughan"> Paper Girls Vol. 4</a>. Another series I enjoy more and more but ultimately don't feel the same love for as I do for this one.<br/><br/>This volume had just the right amount of action, heartbreak, cuteness and oddball humor.<br/><br/>Our favorite young family is in desperate need of some time to heal. But first there are more challenges ahead. Of course I'll be with them every step of the way.<br/><br/>Since this is the eighth volume, from here on out spoilers for the previous books will be inevitable.<br/><br/><img alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg" height="256" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1543430716i/26661910._SX540_.png" width="400"/><br/><br/>If you're still reading you hopefully already know that sadly Alana's baby died in her womb.<br/>Now she's trying to have an abortion. If that wasn't hard enough already, she can suddenly cast a spell that brings her never born child to life. But not really <i>alive</i>. It's more like a manifestation of a possible future. And it comes at a cost.<br/>But seeing Hazel interact with her brother's ghost makes it even harder to let go.<br/><br/>Meanwhile The Will makes himself a new <i>friend</i> that adds to his already considerable amount of problems, Petrichor's character development takes a step forward, Hazel is as sweet and cheeky as ever and Ghüs and Robot Boy have some meaningful conversation and ... well, that would be a spoiler.<br/><br/>Read it for yourself. It's so worth it.<br/><br/><img alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg" height="391" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1543430716i/26661911._SX540_.png" width="400"/></span></div><div class=""></div></div></section></section><section class="ReviewCard__tags"><ul class="CollapsableList"><span tabindex="-1"><a class="Button Button--tag-inline Button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/list/64621419?shelf=fantasy"><span class="Button__labelItem">fantasy</span></a><span tabindex="-1"> </span><a class="Button Button--tag-inline Button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/list/64621419?shelf=graphic-novels-comics-manga"><span class="Button__labelItem">graphic-novels-comics-manga</span></a></span><span tabindex="-1"></span></ul></section><footer class="SocialFooter"><div class="SocialFooter__statsContainer" data-testid="stats"><div class="Button__container"><button class="Button Button--inline Button--small Button--subdued" type="button"><span class="Button__labelItem">51 likes</span></button></div></div><div data-testid="actions"><div class="SocialFooter__action"><div class="Button__container"><button aria-label="Review unliked. class="ReviewText"><section class="ReviewText__content" dir="auto"><div class="TruncatedContent" tabindex="-1"><div class="TruncatedContent__text TruncatedContent__text--large" data-testid="contentContainer" tabindex="-1"><span class="Formatted">I thought the Wild West theme of this volume was pretty cool, but I feel like this one is a weaker volume due to the fact there's not a lot of story covered in it, and it felt slow.<br><br>There's still good moments within this volume, but not on par with previous volumes. <br><br>It was a quick read before they headed on their next adventure, and I'm curious to see what happens next and how relationships develop.</br></br></br></br></span></div><div class=""></div></div></section></section><section 9.3444C-0.0680877 9.57134 -0.0140806 9.88529 0.212865 10.0456L7.00408 14.8432L4.40172 22.6166C4.35092 22.7683 4.37534 22.9352 4.46749 23.066C4.6275 23.2932 4.94137 23.3476 5.16853 23.1876L12 18.3758L18.8317 23.183C18.9625 23.2751 19.1293 23.2994 19.281 23.2486C19.5445 23.1604 19.6865 22.8752 19.5983 22.6117L16.996 14.8432L23.7872 10.0456C23.9206 9.95133 24 9.7981 24 9.63469Z"></path></svg></span></span></div><span class="Text Text__body3"><a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/5388444414">January 17, 2022</a></span></section><section class="ReviewText"><section class="ReviewText__content" dir="auto"><div class="TruncatedContent" tabindex="-1"><div class="TruncatedContent__text TruncatedContent__text--large" data-testid="contentContainer" tabindex="-1"><span class="Formatted">Oh this volume was so beautiful and in so many ways so damn sad. I cannot believe that we’ve gotten to this point in the series. There isn’t much that I can explicitly talk about because of spoilers but once again I feel as though Vaughn challenges our black and white perceptions of certain topics and forces us to look at those same topics from a variety of lenses. I’m nervous about reading the next volume because I know that after the faint glimmer of hope I felt in seeing the final panels of this volume it’s most likely going to come crashing down. We have so many storylines at work at this point and I’m interested in seeing how they’re all going to be tied together and what characters we’re going to lose in the process. There is so much character growth and changes that I found myself actively enjoying a character that initially despised. My heart warmed during so many moments in this story and I know it’s all going to come to end. This is such a great comic series!</span></div><div class=""></div></div></section></section><section class="ReviewCard__tags"><ul class="CollapsableList"><span tabindex="-1"><a class="Button Button--tag-inline Button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/list/27544898?shelf=books-read-in-2022"><span class="Button__labelItem">books-read-in-2022</span></a><span tabindex="-1"> </span><a class="Button Button--tag-inline Button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/list/27544898?shelf=comics"><span class="Button__labelItem">comics</span></a></span><span tabindex="-1"></span></ul></section><footer class="SocialFooter"><div class="SocialFooter__statsContainer" data-testid="stats"><div class="Button__container"><button class="Button Button--inline Button--small Button--subdued" type="button"><span class="Button__labelItem">2 likes</span></button></div></div><div data-testid="actions"><div class="SocialFooter__action"><div class="Button__container"><button aria-label="Review unliked. href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/2109099758">January 10, 2018</a></span></section><section class="ReviewText"><section class="ReviewText__content" dir="auto"><div class="TruncatedContent" tabindex="-1"><div class="TruncatedContent__text TruncatedContent__text--large" data-testid="contentContainer" tabindex="-1"><span class="Formatted">I love Saga so much !! someone please send a defibrilator !!<br><br>alright, short review because I have no energy. While this graphic novel felt especially fast and the plot has begun to meander a bit, my investment in the characters - and pure enjoyment of the story - truly brought this one forward for me. <br><br>I also unfortunately feel that several of my favorite classes are getting less page time. Gwen, Sophie, and Lying Cat are still my favorites, and they had <i>no</i> pagetime here. Our current squad - Marco, Alana, Hazel, Petrichor, King Robot, his son, and Gus - just does not compel me the same way they do. <b>More Gwen and Sophie and Lying Cat, please.</b><br><br>But overall, I found this volume entertaining - I mean, what can I say, they take twenty minutes to read each - and am looking forward to continue this series next year. <br><br><a href="thebookishactress.wordpress.com" rel="nofollow noopener">Blog</a> | <a href="www.goodreads.com/user/show/52545435-elise-the-bookish-actress" rel="nofollow noopener">Goodreads</a> | <a href="twitter.com/girladamparrish" rel="nofollow noopener">Twitter</a> | <a href="www.youtube.com/channel/UCVIY_GxZIuclzsIw9CLSe3g" rel="nofollow noopener">Youtube</a><br><br>// oh my god there are so many<br><a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/2001263259" rel="nofollow noopener">Saga vol. 1</a> - class="ReviewText"><section class="ReviewText__content" dir="auto"><div class="TruncatedContent" tabindex="-1"><div class="TruncatedContent__text TruncatedContent__text--large" data-testid="contentContainer" tabindex="-1"><span class="Formatted">#1 : <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/2616546752?book_show_action=false&amp;from_review_page=1" rel="nofollow noopener">Saga, Vol. 1 (Saga, #1) </a> : 5 stars<br>#2 : <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/2619748204?book_show_action=false&amp;from_review_page=1" rel="nofollow noopener">Saga, Vol. 2 (Saga, #2) </a> : 5 stars<br>#3 : <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/2630546583?book_show_action=false&amp;from_review_page=1" rel="nofollow noopener">Saga, Vol. 3 (Saga, #3) </a> : 5 stars<br>#4 : <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/2632709974?book_show_action=false&amp;from_review_page=1" rel="nofollow noopener">Saga, Vol. 4 (Saga, #4) </a> : 3 stars<br>#5 : <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/2680401169?book_show_action=false&amp;from_review_page=1" rel="nofollow noopener">Saga, Vol. 5 (Saga, #5) </a> : 4 stars<br>#6 : <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/2683299913?book_show_action=false&amp;from_review_page=1" rel="nofollow noopener">Saga, Vol. 6 (Saga, #6)</a> : 4 stars<br>#7 : <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/2688380954?book_show_action=false&amp;from_review_page=1" rel="nofollow noopener">Saga, Vol. 7 (Saga, #7) </a> : 4 stars<br><br><i>Saga Vol.7</i> ended with our characters ruining away from Planet Phang and its destruction and with Alana miscarrying her baby after a dangerous confrontation that nearly killed her. I knew that as Vol.8 will build on the events of the previous one that it will be a roller coaster of emotions and I was completely right. <br><br>In this Volume, The family goes to another planet called Previous so they can remove the Fetus from Alana’s womb because it’s just killing her slowly. But things don’t go as planned and sooner the family find themselves fighting new enemies on every turn and corners. <br><br><u>Before going any further in this review, be careful picking this one up cause It deals with Miscarriage and how it affects the family and also there’s talk of abortion so If you think it could be something you can’t handle , also always trigger warning for violence, torture and shooting a pregnant lady.</u><br><br>So what I love about this series is how it doesn’t leave me anytime to feel relieved or take a breath, it’s intense, it’s bloody and it’s brilliant with its intricate plots and well written characters. But in this particular Volume, there is this emotional punch that I didn’t get in the previous ones, I liked the interactions between Hazel and the vision of her brother and the thief of loss and grief is heavy on this Vol.<br><br>But The ending is really hopeful and beautiful and had this moment that I’ve been waiting for a long time, The narration also gave me Goosebumps but as much as I find the ending satisfying and uplifting, I have this feeling of dread that I can’t shake. I can’t wait to read the next Vol but at the same time, I’m scared to pick it up.</br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></br></span></div><div class=""></div></div></section></section><section class="ReviewCard__tags"><ul class="CollapsableList"><span tabindex="-1"><a class="Button Button--tag-inline Button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/list/42944800?shelf=2019"><span class="Button__labelItem">2019</span></a><span tabindex="-1"> </span><a class="Button Button--tag-inline Button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/list/42944800?shelf=graphic-novels"><span class="Button__labelItem">graphic-novels</span></a><span tabindex="-1"> </span><a class="Button Button--tag-inline Button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/list/42944800?shelf=syfy-dystopia"><span class="Button__labelItem">syfy-dystopia</span></a></span><span tabindex="-1"></span></ul></section><footer class="SocialFooter"><div class="SocialFooter__statsContainer" data-testid="stats"><div class="Button__container"><button class="Button Button--inline Button--small Button--subdued" type="button"><span class="Button__labelItem">35 likes</span></button></div></div><div data-testid="actions"><div class="SocialFooter__action"><div class="Button__container"><button aria-label="Review unliked. 9.63469Z"></path></svg></span></span></div><span class="Text Text__body3"><a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/5388444529">December 28, 2017</a></span></section><section class="ReviewText"><section class="ReviewText__content" dir="auto"><div class="TruncatedContent" tabindex="-1"><div class="TruncatedContent__text TruncatedContent__text--large" data-testid="contentContainer" tabindex="-1"><span class="Formatted">I fear I cannot possibly be objective about this series any longer, I love it so much. For any fan left traumatized and/or depressed after reading Volume 7, you'll be relieved to hear Volume 8 is a much lighter and more hopeful adventure. There are still bittersweet moments, but not of the acutely devastating kind. <br><br>Vaughan and Staples have gone Wild West this time around and placed our intrepid crew in an arid (and possibly dangerous) western-<i>esque</i> landscape. Petrichor has stepped up and has become an irreplaceable and totally kickass supporting character. Even Sir Robot is morphing into something increasingly likeable. The story arc is painted across a smaller canvas this time making everything feel much more intimate. To round things out, there's more The Will and Lying Cat, and more Ghus who I have missed!<br><br>Fans won't be disappointed with <i>Saga's</i> latest entry. For me, this series just keeps getting better and better. Or I'm just a junkie who's completely hooked perpetually jonesing for my next <i>Saga</i> fix. </br></br></br></br></span></div><div class=""></div></div></section></section><section class="ReviewCard__tags"><ul class="CollapsableList"><span tabindex="-1"><a class="Button Button--tag-inline Button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/list/1416912?shelf=2017"><span class="Button__labelItem">2017</span></a><span tabindex="-1"> </span><a class="Button Button--tag-inline Button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/list/1416912?shelf=fantastical-speculative"><span class="Button__labelItem">fantastical-speculative</span></a><span tabindex="-1"> </span><a class="Button Button--tag-inline Button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/list/1416912?shelf=favorites"><span class="Button__labelItem">favorites</span></a></span><span tabindex="-1"></span> <div class="Button__container"><button aria-label="Show all items in the list" class="Button Button--tag-inline Button--small" type="button"><span class="Button__labelItem">...more</span></button></div></ul></section><footer class="SocialFooter"><div data-testid="actions"><div class="SocialFooter__action"><div class="Button__container"><button aria-label="Review unliked. Press to like review" class="Button Button--inline Button--small" type="button"><span class="Button__labelItem"><i class="Icon LikeIcon"><svg viewbox="0 0 24 24"><path d="M14.4813282,6.41129383 L19.1708204,9.70920723 C19.4523479,10.2722622 19.4523479,10.9350066 19.1708204,11.4980616 L19.118034,11.6036344 L19.1708204,11.7092072 C19.4523479,12.2722622 19.4523479,12.9350066 someone? Okay, maybe you’ve never felt that way, but parents usually say that about their offspring, right? Personally, I think it’s almost always a dumb idea to sacrifice your own existence for others. Or worse, for some “cause.” If we were all a little more selfish instead of being in such a hurry to defend everything to the death, the universe would be a much less scary place.\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1517091141i/24948744._SY540_.jpg\" loading=\"lazy\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eOk, if you read the last volume, you know that Alana's baby didn't make it. \u003cbr\u003eSo, once the shock wears off, what exactly happens next? \u003cbr\u003eNow, I know this is touchy territory for a lot of people, but Vaughn went there anyway.\u003cbr\u003eLate-term abortion. If nothing else, you probably heard the sound bites about during the last US election. \u003ci\u003eGood times, good times...\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr\u003ePersonally, I am 100% for late-term abortions.\u003cbr\u003eAnd for those of you out there that actually believe that means doctors pull 9 month old healthy babies from wombs and put them into a wood chipper, then I doubt anything I or anyone else could say will make a difference.\u003cbr\u003eBut.\u003cbr\u003eFor the rest of you?\u003cbr\u003eHere's why someone who has had \u003cb\u003e4 unwanted pregnancies\u003c/b\u003e, but didn't get abortions for any of them (\u003ci\u003e*waves to kids*\u003c/i\u003e), would support another woman's right to choose to end her pregnancy late in the game. \u003cbr\u003eBecause I couldn't imagine how horrible and hard it would be to keep carrying my dying baby inside of me for months. \u003ci\u003eMonths!\u003c/i\u003e And you know your child won't survive. But you can't help them, and you know that your child's suffering hasn't even begun yet. Won't begin, until you give birth to them. \u003cbr\u003eLife is cruel like that sometimes. \u003cbr\u003eChildren die. And parents grieve...for the rest of their lives.\u003cbr\u003eI personally believe that if you are ever in that situation and want to carry the baby to term, then that's your \u003ci\u003echoice\u003c/i\u003e. But I also believe that a woman should have the \u003ci\u003eoption\u003c/i\u003e to begin the grieving and healing sooner.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAt any rate, I thought Vaughn dealt with this subject in a respectful way.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e \u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1515602015i/24865216._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"190\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\" loading=\"lazy\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThe stuff with The Will was short but still made an impact on the story. You get a peek at his \u003ci\u003eorigin story\u003c/i\u003e, while also adding another potentially explosive new personality into the mix!\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1515602170i/24865220._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"160\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\" loading=\"lazy\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI love Petrichor. Even if she is a \u003ci\u003etad\u003c/i\u003e grumpy.\u003cbr\u003eBut she gets to shine like a badass during \u003cb\u003eVol. 8\u003c/b\u003e, and there are some interesting developments that...well, \u003cb\u003espoilers\u003c/b\u003e. Sorry.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1515602625i/24865235._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"170\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\" loading=\"lazy\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eDue to the nature of Alan's pregnancy, there's a rather huge, and spoilery, shock in store for everyone. In Vol 8, things are just as interesting and quirky and sexy and violent as in the seven preceding volumes but this one is particularly satisfying in how It brings everyone together near the end. I hope this series never ends because it is truly one of the greatest comic series going today. I have read loads of other ones in the sci-fi, superhero, and fantasy realms, but Saga just takes everything a notch higher and faster and never panders or condescends. on a life-changing adventure at the westernmost edge of the universe.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eTrying to gather together my scattered thoughts regarding this newest volume in the \u003cstrong\u003eSaga\u003c/strong\u003e series is turning out to be rather hard, so I opted for making this bullet point list below:\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e(Spoilers from here.)\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e• The start of the journey took us to Abortion Town, after the unfortunate events of the last volume, where solid commentary was present in the precarious This is what this volume was truly about: focusing on fleshing out character-based storylines, which is incidentally how I like my stories best. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://bookspoils.wordpress.com\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\"\u003e\n  \u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1516111554i/24885532._SX540_.png\" alt=\"Saga, vol 8 5-- bookspoils\" width=\"554\" height=\"395\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\" loading=\"lazy\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThis moment of impact... She's maturing at a rapid pace.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://bookspoils.wordpress.com\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\"\u003e\n  \u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1516111554i/24885533._SX540_.png\" alt=\"Saga, vol 8 3-- bookspoils\" width=\"556\" height=\"396\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\" loading=\"lazy\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThis girl has known too much loss in her young life.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e• Which then leads me back to Alana having to suffer through her miscarriage; it was utterly hard-hitting. Ultimately, she's one the most formidable and fearsome protagonists I've encountered in my reading of graphic novels.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://bookspoils.wordpress.com\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\"\u003e\n  \u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1516111554i/24885534._SY540_.png\" alt=\"Saga, vol 8 6-- bookspoils\" width=\"400\" height=\"630\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\" loading=\"lazy\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003eHazel's narration throughout was particularly grounding.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e• And last but not least, I have to mention that the completion of this volume was spectacular. I love how everything came together and connected seamlessly. Plus, the gorgeous artwork by Fiona Staples that brings the world and characters within to life.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://bookspoils.wordpress.com\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\"\u003e\n  \u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1516111554i/24885535._SY540_.jpg\" alt=\"Saga, vol 8 7-- bookspoils\" width=\"400\" height=\"610\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\" loading=\"lazy\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1519483221i/25115431.png\" alt=\"bookspoils\" width=\"35\" height=\"31\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\" loading=\"lazy\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1519483221i/25115431.png\" alt=\"bookspoils\" width=\"35\" height=\"31\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\" loading=\"lazy\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1519483221i/25115431.png\" alt=\"bookspoils\" width=\"35\" height=\"31\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\" loading=\"lazy\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1519483221i/25115431.png\" alt=\"bookspoils\" width=\"35\" height=\"31\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\" loading=\"lazy\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ci\u003e\n  \u003cem\u003eNote: I'm an Amazon Affiliate. Schaafsma","webUrl":"https://www.goodreads.com/user/show/269235-dave-schaafsma","contributor":{"__ref":"Contributor:kca://author/amzn1.gr.author.v1.r-M2UAuAxIgiluLbdtY7pA"},"followersCount":31519},"Review:kca://review:goodreads/amzn1.gr.review:goodreads.v1.hw6iFq77O9RZVWHQxiBAcA":{"id":"kca://review:goodreads/amzn1.gr.review:goodreads.v1.hw6iFq77O9RZVWHQxiBAcA","__typename":"Review","creator":{"__ref":"User:269235"},"recommendFor":null,"updatedAt":1677903417556,"createdAt":1514668172000,"spoilerStatus":false,"lastRevisionAt":1646700282977,"text":"“One day, a boy decided to break the rules. And that boy would become my brother”--Hazel \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e(You don't know what this means, and the implications of this, until the very last page).\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eSo I am in the process of rereading all the volumes, more than four years later, and in case you are wondering, the feels are more profound when you have a fuller realization of everything that is happening, so I encourage you to reread these, at least before volume ten arrives, supposedly in August 2022?\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eOriginal review, 12/17/2017, with some small edits and revisions throughout: \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eSaga is clearly one of the greatest comics series of all time, sustaining an impressive critical and popular reception over years. And it is remarkable in part because, while it just looks like a space opera, on the surface, it pushes various envelopes in the process. Volume 7 was powerful, an event of the year in comics, with a sad loss I won’t be specific about, exactly. And now volume 8 deals with the aftermath of the volume 7’s loss, and that makes this once again one of the most powerful volumes of the series, in what were for me with surprising and original turns.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eSo along the way, Vaughn and Staples are at turns profane, hilarious, and heartbreaking, as they deal with hot-button political issues, including miscarriage, and abortion, all of which are of course sensitive personal and political issues today, issues that deeply divide and pain many of us. How can they speak to these issues in a fresh and useful way? Well, they do, heart-rendingly, with originality and a sense of closure. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eWe get a certain portion of (humorous) shock and the profane: \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e*The volume opens with Alana and Sir Robot at the entrance of Abortion Town, which I might make some readers who do not trust Vaughn just close the book. Can any other book anywhere have that shocking opening?! And then turn you right around and make you care, regardless of where you are on the political continuum on this topic?! \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e*In that \"profane\" category, we are introduced to the idea of “dung people”(animated feces?). (Just because they can, and I'll say, it's an act of misdirection to set you up for some of the truly moving things that happen later. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e*A funny scene with cunnilingus (Apple had censored a gay oral sex scene in 2013, so I am sure they thought: Why not see if we again yank the chain again? Similarly, as some people didn't like public breastfeeding a few years ago, Staples puts a close-up of a huge breast nursing Hazel on the cover. Funny? So maybe these images can offend some, but at this point, they can have their fun and know most readers will not cry out in protest. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e*De-nose-ification?\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e*Petrichor praying earnestly for. . . sex? Petrichor goes up in everyone's estimation in this volume, for sure. And then there are moments with Sir Robot. You don't like trans folks? You don't like rich royals? Staples and Vaughn put them together and make you care about them. Yep, we find people to like across the political spectrum, all kinds. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eThere are some other really cool ideas in this one:\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e* “Forecasting” as a special ability, that allows us to experience Hazel’s “brother.” This would seem to be a power like prescience, but in this case it creates a simultaneously anguished and moving set of events I just can't spoil for you.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e*We are introduced to the concept of an endwife (instead of a midwife), which maybe is a little like a hospice nurse, I guess, but I liked how they use it here. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e*Oh, and you were wondering, above: Does Petrichor get an answer to her prayer? Gotta read it, but again, what happens is not obvious to anyone unless you expect the unexpected.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e*There’s cameos of some characters you have missed lately: Lying Cat! And Ghus, of course!\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e*You may know that Saga is a kind of tribute to Star Wars, and you may also know that the westerns George Lucas grew up reading and watching created part of the foundation for his epec series. So it is kind of cool that this volume is conceived as a western, with drawling locals. \u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eI was in this reading much more moved than the first read. Our favorite family Markus, Alana, and Hazel is central, and so connected, we care about them so much. And the scenes with Kurti and Hazel, maybe especially the last scene: Uh. I may not have any actual experience with forecasting--though I have certainly imagined futures of people who no longer live; I have day- and night-dreams of meeting and talking with them--but I do have some painful experiences with child/fetus loss, and in many ways with many family and friends. This thread/sequence was a very moving sequence, let me just say that. It has great surprises in it, and the ending is terrific. Read it!","rating":5,"shelving":{"__typename":"Shelving","shelf":{"__typename":"Shelf","name":"read","webUrl":"https://www.goodreads.com/review/list/269235?shelf=read"},"taggings":[{"__typename":"Tagging","tag":{"__typename":"Tag","name":"vaughn","webUrl":"https://www.goodreads.com/review/list/269235?shelf=vaughn"}},{"__typename":"Tagging","tag":{"__typename":"Tag","name":"gn-superhero-scifi-fantasy","webUrl":"https://www.goodreads.com/review/list/269235?shelf=gn-superhero-scifi-fantasy"}}],"webUrl":"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/5388444281"},"likeCount":1,"viewerHasLiked":null,"commentCount":0},"User:16219087":{"id":16219087,"__typename":"User","legacyId":16219087,"imageUrlSquare":"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/users/1667358429i/16219087._UX200_CR0,1,200,200_.jpg","isAuthor":false,"textReviewsCount":1479,"viewerRelationshipStatus":null,"name":"Chelsea (chelseadolling reads)","webUrl":"https://www.goodreads.com/user/show/16219087-chelsea-chelseadolling-reads","contributor":null,"followersCount":19490},"Review:kca://review:goodreads/amzn1.gr.review:goodreads.v1.GMU3xI9KxO57zyxZZErspA":{"id":"kca://review:goodreads/amzn1.gr.review:goodreads.v1.GMU3xI9KxO57zyxZZErspA","__typename":"Review","creator":{"__ref":"User:16219087"},"recommendFor":null,"updatedAt":1677903418216,"createdAt":1516778253055,"spoilerStatus":false,"lastRevisionAt":1526604844735,"text":"Possibly my favorite volume yet???????? Although some people may wish it all ended here. But when everything seems to be going swimmingly life usually throws you a curve ball. It's just what life does.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eFor me sometimes the plot moved too swiftly here. Occasionally it felt like some things were brushed over or obstacles were moved out of the way too conveniently. So, yeah, probably not my favorite volume. But that one panel with Hazel and Kurti on the sofa... I got a little emotional there. Overall this was still pretty great. On to volume 9.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003ci\u003eBuddy read with \u003ca href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/user/show/3672777-nataliya\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\"\u003eNataliya\u003c/a\u003e, who's one of those people that wished it would have ended here, I suppose.\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e2018 review:\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eMy vote for this year's Goodreads Choice Award for Best Graphic Novel.\u003cbr\u003e\u003ci\u003e(Well, after my write-in vote didn't make it.)\u003c/i\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cb\u003e4.5 stars\u003c/b\u003e and the slight edge over Vaughan's \u003ca href=\"https://goodreads.com/book/show/35989512.Paper_Girls__Vol__4\" title=\"Paper Girls, Vol. 4 by Brian K. Vaughan\" rel=\"noopener\"\u003e Paper Girls Vol. 4\u003c/a\u003e. Another series I enjoy more and more but ultimately don't feel the same love for as I do for this one.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThis volume had just the right amount of action, heartbreak, cuteness and oddball humor.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eOur favorite young family is in desperate need of some time to heal. But first there are more challenges ahead. Of course I'll be with them every step of the way.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eSince this is the eighth volume, from here on out spoilers for the previous books will be inevitable.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1543430716i/26661910._SX540_.png\" width=\"400\" height=\"256\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\" loading=\"lazy\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eIf you're still reading you hopefully already know that sadly Alana's baby died in her womb.\u003cbr\u003eNow she's trying to have an abortion. If that wasn't hard enough already, she can suddenly cast a spell that brings her never born child to life. But not really \u003ci\u003ealive\u003c/i\u003e. It's more like a manifestation of a possible future. And it comes at a cost.\u003cbr\u003eBut seeing Hazel interact with her brother's ghost makes it even harder to let go.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eMeanwhile The Will makes himself a new \u003ci\u003efriend\u003c/i\u003e that adds to his already considerable amount of problems, Petrichor's character development takes a step forward, Hazel is as sweet and cheeky as ever and Ghüs and Robot Boy have some meaningful conversation and ... well, that would be a spoiler.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eRead it for yourself. Vaughan is the writer and co-creator of comic-book series including SAGA, PAPER GIRLS, Y THE LAST MAN, RUNAWAYS, and most recently, BARRIER, a digital comic with artist Marcos Martin about immigration, available from their pay-what-you-want site <a href="http://www.PanelSyndicate.com" rel="noopener nofollow" target="_blank">www.PanelSyndicate.com</a><br/><br/>BKV's work has been recognized at the Eisner, Harvey, Hugo, Shuster, Eagle, and British Fantasy Awards. He sometimes writes for film and television in Los Angeles, where he lives with his family and their dogs Hamburger and Milkshake. </span></div></div></div><div class=""></div></div><hr class="Divider class="ReviewText"><section class="ReviewText__content" dir="auto"><div class="TruncatedContent" tabindex="-1"><div class="TruncatedContent__text TruncatedContent__text--large" data-testid="contentContainer" tabindex="-1"><span class="Formatted"><b>oooh, goodreads choice awards semifinalist for best graphic novel 2018! what will happen?</b><br/><br/><i>When did you first know that you’d give up your life for someone? Okay, maybe you’ve never felt that way, but parents usually say that about their offspring, right? Personally, I think it’s almost always a dumb idea to sacrifice your own existence for others. Or worse, for some “cause.” If we were all a little more selfish instead of being in such a hurry to defend everything to the death, the universe would be a much less scary place.</i><br/><br/><img class="gr-hostedUserImg" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1517091141i/24948744._SY540_.jpg"/><br/><br/>there is so much in this one, it makes my head spin. and for the first time, i’m deeply glad i didn’t read these as individual comic book issues. #43-#46 are excellent and i would only have been frustrated by how short they were and how cliffhanger-y their ends, but #47 and #48 would have felt like total letdowns on their own, just because of who’s there, who’s <i>not</i> there, and as a contrast to how very strong the first four segments of this collection were. and yes, i gave the entire volume five stars despite the last two being less shiny, but i’m terrible at math and -oh no! are those <i>dung people</i>?<br/><br/><img class="gr-hostedUserImg" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1517091141i/24948747._SX540_.jpg"/><br/><br/>basically, the inclusion of dung people rounds any book up to an automatic five stars. <br/><br/>but there are plenty of other things here helping earn that five stars.<br/><br/>this, obviously<br/><br/><img class="gr-hostedUserImg" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1517091141i/24948750._SX540_.jpg"/><br/><br/>also, there are so many wonderful moments of underplayed reactions throughout this series, but there are some particularly funny ones this time out <br/><br/><img class="gr-hostedUserImg" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1517091141i/24948749._SY540_.jpg"/><br/><br/>and hazel’s fumbling attempts at cussin’ are endearing enough<br/><br/><img class="gr-hostedUserImg" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1517091141i/24948751._SX540_.jpg"/><br/><br/>but not as endearing as the contrast between what her parents identify as the teaching moment<br/><br/><img class="gr-hostedUserImg" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1517091141i/24948752._SX540_.jpg"/><br/> <br/>also<br/><br/><img class="gr-hostedUserImg" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1517091141i/24948743._SY540_.jpg"/><br/><br/>all of the abortion town/badlands parts were handled so well - providing a variety of cultural perspectives on the abortion issue that are consistent with other things we know about the values of these different realms, plus some insight into the individuals involved, and a perfect balance of heartbreaking stuff and … less heartbreaking stuff<br/><br/><img class="gr-hostedUserImg" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1517091141i/24948748._SX540_.jpg"/><br/><br/>obviously, hazel is great here, she always is, but she’s also wrestling with some pretty big questions that no one <i>really</i> has the answers for.<br/><br/><img class="gr-hostedUserImg" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1517091141i/24948745._SX540_.jpg"/><br/><br/>petrichor is outstanding in this one; she gets to be maternal and brave and fierce and vulnerable and horny and so many other things, including deeply relieved<br/><br/><img class="gr-hostedUserImg" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1517091141i/24948746._SX540_.jpg"/><br/><br/>and she does give good advice<br/><br/><i>…you are unlike anyone who has ever existed, and that makes you <b>exactly</b> like everyone who has ever existed.</i><br/><br/>she's closer than anyone else to being able to understand hazel's state of mind, and if we had to lose that other hazel-helper, i'm glad petrichor is there to pick up the slack.<br/><br/>and let the record show i am furious at this bitch’s...interior design choices and if she goes ANYWHERE near lying cat, i will draw myself into a little cartoon and breach the panel’s boundaries to cut her into little pieces. <br/><br/><img class="gr-hostedUserImg" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1517091141i/24948753._SY540_.jpg"/><br/><br/>just try me.<br/><br/>*******************************************<br/><br/>OH GOD SO GOOD!<br/><br/>real review coming but if this series ever ends, i might lose my mind. never stop, please.<br/><br/><img class="gr-hostedUserImg" loading="lazy" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1528725630i/25720315.png"/><a href="http://bloggycomelately.com/" rel="nofollow noopener">come to my blog!</a></span></div><div class=""></div></div></section></section><section class="ReviewCard__tags"><ul class="CollapsableList"><span tabindex="-1"><a class="Button Button--tag-inline Button--small" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/list/45618?shelf=youre-a-graphic-novel"><span
